snippet: Mr. Buhari, a former military strongman, defeated Mr. Jonathan, whose government has been criticized for its handling of an Islamist insurgency and sinking economy.
abstract: Nigerians, coming out to vote in country's most competitive presidential race ever, elect former general Muhammadu Buhari; he wins almost 55 percent of vote to Pres Goodluck Jonathan's 45 percent; civilian election will be major change for Nigeria, if power is relinquished serenely.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Buhari, a former military strongman, defeated Mr. Jonathan, whose government has been criticized for its handling of an Islamist insurgency and sinking economy.

headline.main: In Nigeria’s Election, Muhammadu Buhari Defeats Goodluck Jonathan
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Elects Ex-Military Ruler in a Bid to Bolster Its Democracy
